author: Ali, Md. Azahar, Kaushik, Ajeet, Malhotra, B. D., Solanki, Pratima R., Srivastava, Anchal, Srivastava, Saurabh
title: A self assembled monolayer based microfluidic sensor for urea detection
abstract: Urease (Urs) and glutamate dehydrogenase (GLDH) have been covalently co-immobilized onto a self-assembled monolayer (SAM) comprising of 10-carboxy-1-decanthiol (CDT) via EDC\342\200\223NHS chemistry deposited onto one of the two patterned gold (Au) electrodes for estimation of urea using poly(dimethylsiloxane) based microfluidic channels (2 cm \303\227 200 \316\274m \303\227 200 \316\274m). The CDT/Au and Urs-GLDH/CDT/Au electrodes have been characterized using Fourier transform infrared (FTIR) spectroscopy, contact angle (CA), atomic force microscopy (AFM) and electrochemical cyclic voltammetry (CV) techniques. The electrochemical response measurement of a Urs-GLDH/CDT/Au bioelectrode obtained as a function of urea concentration using CV yield linearity as 10 to 100 mg dl\342\210\2221, detection limit as 9 mg dl\342\210\2221 and high sensitivity as 7.5 \316\274A mM\342\210\2221 cm\342\210\2222
